intro.description:
Consume a SOAP Web Service by creating source and view models based on target WSDL file definition.
Note: These steps are sequential and require you to complete or skip each step before being allowed to Perform, Complete or Skip the next step.
To learn more about using cheat sheets click the help icon above.
Press "Click to Begin" button below to start.

item.title: Create SOAP Connection Profile
item.description:
This following action creates an ODA Web Service connection profile using the WSDL URL and end-point information.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch the wizard.
-- > Inputs include: WSDL URL and sample request/response document XML files
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created a SOAP connection profile.
============================================================

item.title: Generate Models
item.description:
This action utilizes the previously defined connection profile by interpreting the WSDL, locating any associated or dependent XML schema files, generating a physical model containing the required invoke procedures for the service, and generating virtual models containing procedures which will build and parse the XML declared as the service messages.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch the model generator wizard.
-- > Select your connection profile and press Validate WSDL.
-- > Set the target folder or project location for your generated models and click Next >.
-- > Select/de-select operations you wish to generate procedures for and click Finish.
-- > Press "Click to Complete" button below when finished.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already generated your models.
============================================================

item.title: Create a VDB
item.description:
Create a VDB containing your generated models.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch New VDB wizard.
-- > Enter a name for your VDB and click Finish to create the VDB and open in editor.
-- > In the VDB editor, use the add models button to add models from your workspace.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created a VDB.
============================================================

item.title: Test your VDB
item.description:
Execute your VDB by deploying to a running Teiid server, creating a JDBC connection to that VDB, opening a SQL Scrapbook Editor and executing queries against your VDB.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch the wizard.
-- > Browse and select your VDB from your workspace and click OK.
-- > The Data Source Explorer perspective will be activated.
-- > A SQL Scrapbook editor will be opened using the generated VDB's JDBC connection.
-- > Follow the instructions in the scrapbook to perform ad-hoc queries.
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created a VDB.
============================================================
